name: sprocket
description: Bioinformatics workflow engine built on the Workflow Description Language (WDL)

repo.name: sprocket
repo.description: A bioinformatics workflow engine built on top of the Workflow Description Language (WDL).

readme.summary: Well-structured README with excellent installation instructions but lacks practical usage examples and quick-start guidance for actually running workflows.
readme.top_issue: No quick-start example showing how to write and run a simple WDL workflow - users can install the tool but won't know how to use it for basic bioinformatics tasks

injection_risks.description: Command injection vulnerability in `bump_version` function due to use of `Command::new("cargo").arg("fetch")` without input validation.
Potential command injection vulnerability in `publish` function due to use of `Command::new"cargo".arg("publish")` without input validation.

security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including command injection vulnerabilities and lack of input validation, which could lead to potential attacks.

common_complaints: Network resilience (transient HTTP errors causing process crashes)
Configuration limitations (restricted runtime keys for backend-specific options)
Input parameter propagation not working as expected
sentiment.summary: Sprocket shows active maintenance with recent issue engagement, but users report critical performance and reliability problems that warrant attention.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and patient. They provide technical depth and encourage new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-13)
82 open issues with no activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no active development
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests no versioned releases
maintenance.summary: The sprocket package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a recent commit timestamp, accumulating 82 unresolved issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-categorized and appears comprehensive, but lacks clear marking of breaking changes and migration guides.

governance.summary: The project lacks a formal succession plan but has documented decision-making processes and multiple maintainers, reducing single-point-of-failure risk.

project_metrics.description: A bioinformatics workflow engine built on top of the Workflow Description Language (WDL).

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is thorough but lacks a clear quick start guide and troubleshooting section, making it difficult for new users to get started.
concerns: Docs: Lack of a concise quick start guide
Community: Sprocket doesn't pass conformance tests in WDL v1.2.1
Community: Version restrictions on optional call input semantics
Security: Command injection vulnerability in `bump_version` function
Security: Command injection vulnerability in `bump_version` function due to use of `Command::new("cargo").arg("fetch")` without input validation.
highlights: High number of commits and merged PRs in the past six months
Recent activity with a commit on January 8, 2026
Multiple contributors active in the past six months
